metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33910 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
basic/unit-name.c in systemd prior to 246.15, 247.8, 248.5, and 249.1 has aMemory Allocation with an Excessive Size Value (involving strdupa andalloca for a pathname controlled by a local attacker) that results in anoperating system crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: systemd package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.31+esm1').
